mckay.utilities.gui.tables

Class MultiLineCellRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • mckay.utilities.gui.tables.MultiLineCellRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer

    public class MultiLineCellRenderer
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer
    Used to allow cells in a JTable column to have entries that take multiple lines.

    Use as follows:

    MultiLineCellRenderer renderer = new MultiLineCellRenderer( SwingConstants.LEFT,
    SwingConstants.CENTER );
    JTable table = new JTable();
    TableColumnModel column_model = instances_table.getColumnModel();
    column_model.getColumn(0).setCellRenderer(renderer);

    Note that when a table entry is retrieved that is assigned this renderer, the object returned will in fact be an array. For example, would use:

    Object[] entry = (Object[]) table.getModel().getValueAt(0, 0);

    rather than the standard:

    Object entry = table.getModel().getValueAt(0, 0);

    This class is derived from the code on pp. 629-33 of

    Topley, K. 2000. Core Swing advanced programming. Upper Saddle River, NJ: Prentice Hall.

    Author:
    Cory McKay
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Configures a label for one line of the cell. This can be overridden by derived classes.
        Parameters:
        l - The JLabel to configure.
        value - The text value to label l with.
        lineNumber - The line number.
        cellForeground - The foreground color of the cell.
